<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span></h2>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="reflist reflist-upper-alpha">
<div class="mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-altnames-2"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-altnames_2-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-altnames_2-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Article 35 of the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Argentine_Constitution" title="Argentine Constitution">Argentine Constitution</a> gives equal recognition to the names "<a href="/wiki/United_Provinces_of_the_R%C3%ADo_de_la_Plata" title="United Provinces of the Río de la Plata">United Provinces of the Río de la Plata</a>", "Argentine Republic" and "Argentine Confederation" and using "Argentine Nation" in the making and enactment of laws.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEConstitution_of_Argentinaart._35_1-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEConstitution_of_Argentinaart._35-1">[1]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-excl_area-15"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-excl_area_15-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-excl_area_15-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-excl_area_15-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Area does not include territorial claims in <a href="/wiki/Argentine_Antarctica#Argentine_claim" title="Argentine Antarctica">Antarctica</a> (965,597 km<sup><small>2</small></sup>, including the <a href="/wiki/South_Orkney_Islands" title="South Orkney Islands">South Orkney Islands</a>), the <a href="/wiki/Falkland_Islands" title="Falkland Islands">Falkland Islands</a> (11,410 km<sup><small>2</small></sup>), the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/South_Georgia_Island" title="South Georgia Island">South Georgia</a> (3,560 km<sup><small>2</small></sup>) and the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/South_Sandwich_Islands" title="South Sandwich Islands">South Sandwich Islands</a> (307 km<sup><small>2</small></sup>).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-totalpop_14-0"><a href="#cite_note-totalpop-14">[10]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-42"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-42">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The poem's full name is <i>La Argentina y conquista del Río de la Plata, con otros acaecimientos de los reinos del Perú, Tucumán y estado del Brasil</i>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-48"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-48">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Also stated in article 35 of all subsequent amendments: 1866, 1898, 1949, 1957, 1972 and 1994 (current)</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-71"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-71">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">San Martín's military campaigns, together with those of <a href="/wiki/Sim%C3%B3n_Bol%C3%ADvar" title="Simón Bolívar">Simón Bolívar</a> in <a href="/wiki/Gran_Colombia" title="Gran Colombia">Gran Colombia</a> are collectively known as the <a href="/wiki/Spanish_American_wars_of_independence" title="Spanish American wars of independence">Spanish American wars of independence</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEGalasso2011185–252vol._I_70-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEGalasso2011185–252vol._I-70">[62]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-138"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-138">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The Full Stop and Due Obedience laws had been abrogated by Congress in 1998.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-137"><a href="#cite_note-137">[128]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-167"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-167">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Includes higher plants only: <a href="/wiki/Fern" title="Fern">ferns</a> and fern allies, <a href="/wiki/Conifer" title="Conifer">conifers</a> and <a href="/wiki/Cycad" title="Cycad">cycads</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Flowering_plant" title="Flowering plant">flowering plants</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-wcmc_166-1"><a href="#cite_note-wcmc-166">[156]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-168"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-168">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Includes only birds that breed in Argentina, not those that migrate or winter there.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-wcmc_166-2"><a href="#cite_note-wcmc-166">[156]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-169"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-169">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Excludes marine mammals.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-wcmc_166-3"><a href="#cite_note-wcmc-166">[156]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-188"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-188">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Since 2012 suffrage is optional for ages 16 and 17.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-187"><a href="#cite_note-187">[174]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-203"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-203">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Although not a province, the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/City_of_Buenos_Aires" title="City of Buenos Aires">City of Buenos Aires</a> is a federally <a href="/wiki/Autonomous_city" title="Autonomous city">autonomous city</a>, and as such its local organization has similarities with provinces: it has its own constitution, an elected mayor and representatives to the Senate and Deputy chambers.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEConstitution_of_Argentinaart._129_202-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEConstitution_of_Argentinaart._129-202">[188]</a></sup> As <a href="/wiki/Federal_capital" title="Federal capital">federal capital</a> of the nation it holds the status of <a href="/wiki/Federal_district" title="Federal district">federal district</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-235"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-235">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The other top developing nations being Brazil, China, India, Indonesia, Mexico, South Africa and Turkey.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-undp2013_234-1"><a href="#cite_note-undp2013-234">[219]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-339"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-339">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Though not declared official <i><a href="/wiki/De_jure" title="De jure">de jure</a></i>, the Spanish language is the only one used in the wording of laws, decrees, resolutions, official documents and public acts.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-342"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-342">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">English is also the primary language of the disputed Falkland Islands.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-343"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-343">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Many elder people also speak a <a href="/wiki/Macaronic_language" title="Macaronic language">macaronic language</a> of Italian and Spanish called <i><a href="/wiki/Cocoliche" title="Cocoliche">cocoliche</a></i>, which was originated by the Italian immigrants in the late 19th century.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-344"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-344">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">It gave origin to a mixture of Spanish and German called <i><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Belgranodeutsch" title="Belgranodeutsch">Belgranodeutsch</a></i>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-351"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-351">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">In practice this privileged status amounts to tax-exempt school subsidies and licensing preferences for radio broadcasting frequencies.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-irfr1_350-0"><a href="#cite_note-irfr1-350">[330]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-leveldiff-366"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-leveldiff_366-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-leveldiff_366-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Level duration depends on jurisdiction.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-370"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-370">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The post-graduate sub-level of higher education is usually paid.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-398"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-398">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The other top venues being Berlin's <a href="/wiki/Konzerthaus_Berlin" title="Konzerthaus Berlin">Konzerthaus</a>, Vienna's <a href="/wiki/Musikverein" title="Musikverein">Musikverein</a>, Amsterdam's <a href="/wiki/Concertgebouw" title="Concertgebouw">Concertgebouw</a> and Boston's <a href="/wiki/Symphony_Hall,_Boston" title="Symphony Hall, Boston">Symphony Hall</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELong200921–25_397-1"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTELong200921–25-397">[374]</a></sup></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span></h2>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1011085734" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="reflist reflist-columns references-column-width" style="column-width: 30em;">
<ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEConstitution_of_Argentinaart._35-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEConstitution_of_Argentinaart._35_1-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFConstitution_of_Argentina">Constitution of Argentina</a>, art. 35.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTECrow1992457Kopka20115-3"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTECrow1992457Kopka20115_3-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFCrow1992">Crow 1992</a>, p. 457: "In the meantime, while the crowd assembled in the plaza continued to shout its demands at the cabildo, the sun suddenly broke through the overhanging clouds and clothed the scene in brilliant light. The people looked upward with one accord and took it as a favorable omen for their cause. This was the origin of the "sun of May" which has appeared in the center of the Argentine flag and on the Argentine coat of arms ever since."; <a href="#CITEREFKopka2011">Kopka 2011</a>, p. 5: "The sun's features are those of <a href="/wiki/Inti" title="Inti">Inti</a>, the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Inca" title="Inca">Incan</a> sun god. The sun commemorates the appearance of the sun through cloudy skies on 25 May 1810, during the first mass demonstration in favor of independence."</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Corrientes-5598-5"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Corrientes-5598_5-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Corrientes-5598_5-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a class="external text" href="https://hcdcorrientes.gov.ar/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/Ley5598.pdf" rel="nofollow"><span style="font-style:italic">Ley No. 5598<span class="nowrap"> </span>de la Provincia de Corrientes, 22 October 2004</span></a><span class="nowrap"> </span><span class="languageicon">(in Spanish)</span><span style="font-style:italic"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-imf2-17"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-imf2_17-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-imf2_17-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-imf2_17-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-imf2_17-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.imf.org/en/Publications/WEO/weo-database/2021/October/weo-report?c=213,&amp;s=NGDPD,PPPGDP,NGDPDPC,PPPPC,&amp;sy=2019&amp;ey=2026&amp;ssm=0&amp;scsm=1&amp;scc=0&amp;ssd=1&amp;ssc=0&amp;sic=0&amp;sort=country&amp;ds=.&amp;br=1" rel="nofollow">"Argentina"</a>. <i>World Economic Outlook Database, October 2021</i>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-gini-18"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-gini_18-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-gini_18-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SI.POV.GINI?locations=AR" rel="nofollow">"GINI index (World Bank estimate) – Argentina"</a>. World Bank. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20161109222228/http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/SI.POV.GINI?locations=AR" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 9 November 2016<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">22 March</span> 2020</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=GINI+index+%28World+Bank+estimate%29+%E2%80%93+Argentina&amp;rft.pub=World+Bank&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fdata.worldbank.org%2Findicator%2FSI.POV.GINI%3Flocations%3DAR&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AArgentina"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEAbad_de_Santillán197117-22"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEAbad_de_Santillán197117_22-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEAbad_de_Santillán197117_22-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFAbad_de_Santillán1971">Abad de Santillán 1971</a>, p. 17.</span>

<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTECrow1992128-23"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTECrow1992128_23-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTECrow1992128_23-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFCrow1992">Crow 1992</a>, p. 128.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTELevene194811Sánchez_Viamonte1948196–97Vanossi196411-24"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTELevene194811Sánchez_Viamonte1948196–97Vanossi196411_24-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTELevene194811Sánchez_Viamonte1948196–97Vanossi196411_24-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFLevene1948">Levene 1948</a>, p. 11: "[After the Viceroyalty became] a new period that commenced with the revolution of 1810, whose plan consisted in declaring the independence of a nation, thus turning the legal bond of vassalage into one of citizenship as a component of sovereignty and, in addition, organizing the democratic republic."; <a href="#CITEREFSánchez_Viamonte1948">Sánchez Viamonte 1948</a>, pp. 196–97: "The Argentine nation was a unity in colonial times, during the Viceroyalty, and remained so after the revolution of May 1810. [...] The provinces never acted as independent sovereign states, but as entities created within the nation and as integral parts of it, incidentally affected by internal conflicts."; <a href="#CITEREFVanossi1964">Vanossi 1964</a>, p. 11: "[The Argentine nationality is a] unique national entity, successor to the Viceroyalty, which, after undergoing a long period of anarchy and disorganization, adopted a decentralized form in 1853–1860 under the Constitution."</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-25"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-25">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFGordon_A._Bridger2013">Gordon A. Bridger (2013). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=jXNgInLwwIoC&amp;pg=PA101" rel="nofollow"><i>Britain and the Making of Argentina</i></a>. p. 101. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9781845646844" title="Special:BookSources/9781845646844"><bdi>9781845646844</bdi></a>. <q>Some 86% identify themselves as being of European descent, of whom 60% would claim Italian links</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Britain+and+the+Making+of+Argentina&amp;rft.pages=101&amp;rft.date=2013&amp;rft.isbn=9781845646844&amp;rft.au=Gordon+A.+Bridger&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DjXNgInLwwIoC%26pg%3DPA101&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AArgentina"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-LaMatanza-26"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-LaMatanza_26-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-LaMatanza_26-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source" id="CITEREFDepartamento_de_Derecho_y_Ciencias_Políticas_de_la_Universidad_Nacional_de_La_Matanza2011">Departamento de Derecho y Ciencias Políticas de la <a href="/wiki/National_University_of_La_Matanza" title="National University of La Matanza">Universidad Nacional de La Matanza</a> (14 November 2011). <a class="external text" href="http://infouniversidades.siu.edu.ar/noticia.php?titulo=historias_de_inmigrantes_italianos_en_argentina&amp;id=1432" rel="nofollow">"Historias de inmigrantes italianos en Argentina"</a> (in Spanish). infouniversidades.siu.edu.ar. <q>Se estima que en la actualidad, el 90% de la población argentina tiene alguna ascendencia europea y que al menos 25 millones están relacionados con algún inmigrante de Italia.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Historias+de+inmigrantes+italianos+en+Argentina&amp;rft.pub=infouniversidades.siu.edu.ar&amp;rft.date=2011-11-14&amp;rft.au=Departamento+de+Derecho+y+Ciencias+Pol%C3%ADticas+de+la+Universidad+Nacional+de+La+Matanza&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Finfouniversidades.siu.edu.ar%2Fnoticia.php%3Ftitulo%3Dhistorias_de_inmigrantes_italianos_en_argentina%26id%3D1432&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AArgentina"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-33"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-33">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFBoltInklaarde_Jongvan_Zanden2018">Bolt, Jutta; Inklaar, Robert; de Jong, Herman; van Zanden, Jan Luiten (2018). <a class="external text" href="https://www.rug.nl/ggdc/historicaldevelopment/maddison/releases/maddison-project-database-2018" rel="nofollow"><i>Rebasing 'Maddison': new income comparisons and the shape of long-run economic development</i></a> (2018 ed.). <li id="cite_note-34"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-34">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.economist.com/briefing/2014/02/17/a-century-of-decline" rel="nofollow">"The tragedy of Argentina – A century of decline"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Economist" title="The Economist">The Economist</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">15 May</span> 2020</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Economist&amp;rft.atitle=The+tragedy+of+Argentina+%E2%80%93+A+century+of+decline&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.economist.com%2Fbriefing%2F2014%2F02%2F17%2Fa-century-of-decline&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AArgentina"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-developed-35"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-developed_35-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-developed_35-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.economist.com/node/2704457" rel="nofollow">"Becoming a serious country"</a>. <i>The Economist</i>. London. 3 June 2004. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20140320033128/http://www.economist.com/node/2704457" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 20 March 2014. <q>Argentina is thus not a "developing country". Uniquely, it achieved development and then lost it again.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Economist&amp;rft.atitle=Becoming+a+serious+country&amp;rft.date=2004-06-03&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.economist.com%2Fnode%2F2704457&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AArgentina"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEWood198818Solomon19973-36"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEWood198818Solomon19973_36-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEWood198818Solomon19973_36-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFWood1988">Wood 1988</a>, p. 18; <a href="#CITEREFSolomon1997">Solomon 1997</a>, p. 3.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEHuntington20006Nierop200161Lake200955Papadopoulos2010283Malamud20119Boughton2012101-37"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHuntington20006Nierop200161Lake200955Papadopoulos2010283Malamud20119Boughton2012101_37-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEHuntington20006Nierop200161Lake200955Papadopoulos2010283Malamud20119Boughton2012101_37-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFHuntington2000">Huntington 2000</a>, p. 6; <a href="#CITEREFNierop2001">Nierop 2001</a>, p. 61: "Secondary regional powers in Huntington's view (Huntington, 2000, p. 6) include Great Britain, Ukraine, Japan, South Korea, Pakistan, Saudi Arabia and Argentina."; <a href="#CITEREFLake2009">Lake 2009</a>, p. 55: "The US has created a foundation upon which the regional powers, especially Argentina and Brazil, can develop their own rules for further managing regional relations."; <a href="#CITEREFPapadopoulos2010">Papadopoulos 2010</a>, p. 283: "The driving force behind the adoption of the MERCOSUR agreement was similar to that of the establishment of the EU: the hope of limiting the possibilities of traditional military hostility between the major regional powers, Brazil and Argentina."; <a href="#CITEREFMalamud2011">Malamud 2011</a>, p. 9: "Though not a surprise, the position of Argentina, Brazil's main regional partner, as the staunchest opponent of its main international ambition [to win a permanent seat on the UN Security Council] dealt a heavy blow to Brazil's image as a regional leader."; <a href="#CITEREFBoughton2012">Boughton 2012</a>, p. 101: "When the U.S. Treasury organized the next round of finance meetings, it included several non-APEC members, including all the European members of the G7, the Latin American powers Argentina and Brazil, and such other emerging markets as India, Poland, and South Africa."</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEMorris198863AdlerGreve200978Ruiz-DanaGoldschagClaroBlanco200918-38"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEMorris198863AdlerGreve200978Ruiz-DanaGoldschagClaroBlanco200918_38-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEMorris198863AdlerGreve200978Ruiz-DanaGoldschagClaroBlanco200918_38-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFMorris1988">Morris 1988</a>, p. 63: "Argentina has been the leading military and economic power in the Southern Cone in the Twentieth Century."; <a href="#CITEREFAdlerGreve2009">Adler &amp; Greve 2009</a>, p. 78: "The southern cone of South America, including Argentina and Brazil, the two regional powers, has recently become a pluralistic security community."; <a href="#CITEREFRuiz-DanaGoldschagClaroBlanco2009">Ruiz-Dana et al. 2009</a>, p. 18: "[...] notably by linking the Southern Cone's rival regional powers, Brazil and Argentina."</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Major_Non-NATO_Ally_Status-39"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Major_Non-NATO_Ally_Status_39-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Major_Non-NATO_Ally_Status_39-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.state.gov/major-non-nato-ally-status/" rel="nofollow">"Major Non-NATO Ally Status"</a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Major+Non-NATO+Ally+Status&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.state.gov%2Fmajor-non-nato-ally-status%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AArgentina"></span></span>
</li>

</li>
<li id="cite_note-173"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-173">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFBeckZimmermannMcVicarVergopolan2018">Beck, Hylke E.; Zimmermann, Niklaus E.; McVicar, Tim R.; Vergopolan, Noemi; Berg, Alexis; Wood, Eric F. <li id="cite_note-244"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-244">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source" id="CITEREFArena2022">Arena, Sofía Solari (9 September 2022). <a class="external text" href="https://www.eldestapeweb.com/internacionales/brics/de-brics-a-bricsa-como-sera-el-ingreso-de-argentina-al-bloque--20229923390" rel="nofollow">"De BRICS a BRICSA: cómo será el ingreso de Argentina al bloque"</a>. <i>www.eldestapeweb.com</i> (in Spanish). <a class="external text" href="https://archive.today/BneWp" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 10 September 2022<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-270"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-270">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.indexmundi.com/argentina/roadways.html" rel="nofollow">"Argentina – Roadways"</a>. (1 March 2007). <a class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3142769" rel="nofollow">"Argentine Population Genetic Structure: Large Variance in Amerindian Contribution"</a>. <li id="cite_note-ref1-325"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-ref1_325-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-ref1_325-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070610215422/http://www.cels.org.ar/Site_cels/publicaciones/informes_pdf/1998.Capitulo7.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Capítulo VII. Inmigrantes"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. 10 June 2007. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.cels.org.ar/Site_cels/publicaciones/informes_pdf/1998.Capitulo7.pdf" rel="nofollow">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on 10 June 2007<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">3 December</span> 2017</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Cap%C3%ADtulo+VII.+Inmigrantes&amp;rft.date=2007-06-10&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.cels.org.ar%2FSite_cels%2Fpublicaciones%2Finformes_pdf%2F1998.Capitulo7.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AArgentina"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-ref2-326"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-ref2_326-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110814202421/http://docentes.fe.unl.pt/~satpeg/PapersInova/Labor%20and%20Immigration%20in%20LA-2005.pdf" rel="nofollow">"European immigration into Latin America, 1870–1930"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. 14 August 2011. <li id="cite_note-Lizcano-327"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Lizcano_327-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFFernández,_Francisco_Lizcano2007">Fernández, Francisco Lizcano (2007). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=LcabJ98-t1wC&amp;pg=PA93" rel="nofollow"><i>Composición Étnica de las Tres Áreas Culturales del Continente Americano al Comienzo del Siglo XXI</i></a>. p. 93. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-970-757-052-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-970-757-052-8"><bdi>978-970-757-052-8</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Composici%C3%B3n+%C3%89tnica+de+las+Tres+%C3%81reas+Culturales+del+Continente+Americano+al+Comienzo+del+Siglo+XXI&amp;rft.pages=93&amp;rft.date=2007&amp;rft.isbn=978-970-757-052-8&amp;rft.au=Fern%C3%A1ndez%2C+Francisco+Lizcano&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DLcabJ98-t1wC%26pg%3DPA93&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AArgentina"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-328"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-328">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFCraughwell2013">Craughwell, Thomas J. (2013). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=SuC7CgAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PT63" rel="nofollow"><i>Pope Francis: The Pope from the End of the Earth</i></a>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-Lizcano2007-329"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Lizcano2007_329-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source" id="CITEREFLizcano_Fernández">Lizcano Fernández, Francisco. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20130626010236/http://convergencia.uaemex.mx/rev38/38pdf/LIZCANO.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Composición Étnica de las Tres Áreas Culturales del Continente Americano al Comienzo del Siglo XXI"</a> [Ethnic Composition of the Three Cultural Areas of the American Continent at the Beginning of the 21st Century] <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>Convergencia. Revista de Ciencias Sociales</i> (in Spanish). Toluca, México: Universidad Autónoma del Estado de México: 194–195. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://convergencia.uaemex.mx/rev38/38pdf/LIZCANO.pdf" rel="nofollow">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on 26 June 2013. <q>En principio, se pueden distinguir dos grupos muy distintos al interior de esta etnia: el que procede de Asia occidental (sobre todo árabes cristianos llegados desde Siria y Líbano) y el que salió de Asia oriental (chinos y japoneses principalmente).</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Convergencia.+Revista+de+Ciencias+Sociales&amp;rft.atitle=Composici%C3%B3n+%C3%89tnica+de+las+Tres+%C3%81reas+Culturales+del+Continente+Americano+al+Comienzo+del+Siglo+XXI&amp;rft.pages=194-195&amp;rft.aulast=Lizcano+Fern%C3%A1ndez&amp;rft.aufirst=Francisco&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fconvergencia.uaemex.mx%2Frev38%2F38pdf%2FLIZCANO.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AArgentina"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-330"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-330">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFSánchez,_Gonzalo2010">Sánchez, Gonzalo (27 September 2010). <a class="external text" href="http://www.clarin.com/sociedad/comunidad-china-duplico-ultimos-anos_0_343165728.html" rel="nofollow">"La comunidad china en el país se duplicó en los últimos 5 años"</a>. </li>
<li id="cite_note-331"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-331">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Masterson, Daniel M. and Sayaka Funada-Classen. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Japanese_in_Latin_America" title="The Japanese in Latin America">The Japanese in Latin America</a></i>. <a href="/wiki/University_of_Illinois_Press" title="University of Illinois Press">University of Illinois Press</a>, 2004. <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/0252071441" title="Special:BookSources/0252071441">0252071441</a>, 9780252071447. p. 146-147.</span>

<li id="cite_note-Elindependiente-332"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Elindependiente_332-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20140908043743/http://www.elindependiente.com.ar/papel/hoy/archivo_2004/noticias_v.asp?39074" rel="nofollow">"Recopilaron casi 200 años de los sirio libaneses en Argentina"</a>. <i>El Independiente</i> (in Spanish). Retrieved <span class="nowrap">9 November</span> 2021</span>. <q>González convenció a sus pares de rechazarla, con el argumento de que eran "los más europeos del Asia y son sumisos y laboriosos".</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=El+Independiente&amp;rft.atitle=Recopilaron+casi+200+a%C3%B1os+de+los+sirio+libaneses+en+Argentina&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.elindependiente.com.ar%2Fpapel%2Fhoy%2Farchivo_2004%2Fnoticias_v.asp%3F39074&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AArgentina"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-333"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-333">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source" id="CITEREFLizcano_Fernández">Lizcano Fernández, Francisco. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20130626010236/http://convergencia.uaemex.mx/rev38/38pdf/LIZCANO.pdf" rel="nofollow">"Composición Étnica de las Tres Áreas Culturales del Continente Americano al Comienzo del Siglo XXI"</a> [Ethnic Composition of the Three Cultural Areas of the American Continent at the Beginning of the 21st Century] <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>Convergencia. Revista de Ciencias Sociales</i> (in Spanish). Toluca, México: Universidad Autónoma del Estado de México: 194. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://convergencia.uaemex.mx/rev38/38pdf/LIZCANO.pdf" rel="nofollow">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on 26 June 2013. <q>La  etnia  asiática  tiene  su  origen  en  los  flujos  migratorios que partieron de diversos países de Asia, os cuales fueron especialmente relevantes durante la segunda mitad del siglo XIX y la primera mitad del XX.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Convergencia.+Revista+de+Ciencias+Sociales&amp;rft.atitle=Composici%C3%B3n+%C3%89tnica+de+las+Tres+%C3%81reas+Culturales+del+Continente+Americano+al+Comienzo+del+Siglo+XXI&amp;rft.pages=194&amp;rft.aulast=Lizcano+Fern%C3%A1ndez&amp;rft.aufirst=Francisco&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fconvergencia.uaemex.mx%2Frev38%2F38pdf%2FLIZCANO.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AArgentina"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-onlinelibrary.wiley.com-334"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-onlinelibrary.wiley.com_334-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation journal cs1" id="CITEREFCorachLaoBobilloVan_Der_Gaag2010">Corach, Daniel; Lao, Oscar; Bobillo, Cecilia; Van Der Gaag, Kristiaan; Zuniga, Sofia; Vermeulen, Mark; Van Duijn, Kate; Goedbloed, Miriam; Vallone, Peter M; Parson, Walther; De Knijff, Peter; Kayser, Manfred (2010). <li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTELewisSimonsFennig2014-340"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTELewisSimonsFennig2014_340-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTELewisSimonsFennig2014_340-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTELewisSimonsFennig2014_340-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTELewisSimonsFennig2014_340-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTELewisSimonsFennig2014_340-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTELewisSimonsFennig2014_340-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTELewisSimonsFennig2014_340-6"><sup><i><b>g</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTELewisSimonsFennig2014_340-7"><sup><i><b>h</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTELewisSimonsFennig2014_340-8"><sup><i><b>i</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTELewisSimonsFennig2014_340-9"><sup><i><b>j</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTELewisSimonsFennig2014_340-10"><sup><i><b>k</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTELewisSimonsFennig2014_340-11"><sup><i><b>l</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTELewisSimonsFennig2014_340-12"><sup><i><b>m</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFLewisSimonsFennig2014">Lewis, Simons &amp; Fennig 2014</a>.</span>

<li id="cite_note-educ1-367"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-educ1_367-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20140226003634/http://www.indec.gov.ar/nuevaweb/cuadros/5/P7-P_Total_pais.xls" rel="nofollow">"Población de 10 años y más por condición de alfabetismo y sexo, según provincia. <li id="cite_note-educ2-368"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-educ2_368-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-educ2_368-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20140226003726/http://www.indec.gov.ar/nuevaweb/cuadros/5/P29-Total_pais.xls" rel="nofollow">"Total del país. Población de 5 años y más que asistió a un establecimiento educativo por nivel de educación alcanzado y completud del nivel, según sexo y grupo de edad. Año 2010"</a>. <i>Censo Nacional de Población, Hogares y Viviendas 2010</i> (in Spanish). Buenos Aires: INDEC – Instituto Nacional de Estadística y Censos. 2010. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.indec.gov.ar/nuevaweb/cuadros/5/P29-Total_pais.xls" rel="nofollow">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(XLS)</span> on 26 February 2014<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">9 May</span> 2014</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Censo+Nacional+de+Poblaci%C3%B3n%2C+Hogares+y+Viviendas+2010&amp;rft.atitle=Total+del+pa%C3%ADs.+Poblaci%C3%B3n+de+5+a%C3%B1os+y+m%C3%A1s+que+asisti%C3%B3+a+un+establecimiento+educativo+por+nivel+de+educaci%C3%B3n+alcanzado+y+completud+del+nivel%2C+seg%C3%BAn+sexo+y+grupo+de+edad.+A%C3%B1o+2010&amp;rft.date=2010&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.indec.gov.ar%2Fnuevaweb%2Fcuadros%2F5%2FP29-Total_pais.xls&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AArgentina"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-pato2-415"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-pato2_415-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110706075011/http://www.en.argentina.ar/_en/sports/C480-pato-argentinas-national-sport.php" rel="nofollow">"Pato, Argentina's national sport"</a>. <i>Argentina – Portal público de noticias de la República Argentina</i>. <li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTERodríguez2009164–65-423"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTERodríguez2009164–65_423-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFRodríguez2009">Rodríguez 2009</a>, pp. 164–65.</span>

<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTENaurightParrish2012144-424"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTENaurightParrish2012144_424-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFNaurightParrish2012">Nauright &amp; Parrish 2012</a>, p. 144.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTENaurightParrish2012135-425"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTENaurightParrish2012135_425-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFNaurightParrish2012">Nauright &amp; Parrish 2012</a>, p. 135.</span>
</li>

Newport, RI: International Tennis Hall of Fame and Museum. 2014. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20140214070259/http://www.tennisfame.com/hall-of-famers/members" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 14 February 2014.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Hall+of+Fame+Members&amp;rft.place=Newport%2C+RI&amp;rft.pub=International+Tennis+Hall+of+Fame+and+Museum&amp;rft.date=2014&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.tennisfame.com%2Fhall-of-famers%2Fmembers&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AArgentina"></span></span>
</li>

<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Books">Books</span></h3>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main page: <a href="/wiki/Category:Books_about_Argentina" title="Category:Books about Argentina">Category:Books about Argentina</a></div>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1054258005" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="refbegin refbegin-columns references-column-width" style="column-width: 30em">
<ul><li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source" id="CITEREFAbad_de_Santillán1971"><a href="/wiki/Diego_Abad_de_Santill%C3%A1n" title="Diego Abad de Santillán">Abad de Santillán, Diego</a> (1971). <i>Historia Argentina</i> (in Spanish). Buenos Aires: Tipográfica Editora Argentina.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Historia+Argentina&amp;rft.place=Buenos+Aires&amp;rft.pub=Tipogr%C3%A1fica+Editora+Argentina&amp;rft.date=1971&amp;rft.aulast=Abad+de+Santill%C3%A1n&amp;rft.aufirst=Diego&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AArgentina"></span></li>
<li><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFAdlerGreve2009">Adler, Emanuel; Greve, Patricia (2009). <div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Organization_of_American_States_(OAS)" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks hlist mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Organization_of_American_States" title="Template:Organization of <li>Officially the Republic of China, participates as "<a href="/wiki/Chinese_Taipei" title="Chinese Taipei">Separate Customs Territory of Taiwan, Penghu, Kinmen and Matsu</a>", and "Chinese Taipei" in short.</li></ol>
